title: Is it possible to retake the O level exam after A levels, just to improve the grades? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is GCSEs nowadays, but there is no bar on you retaking them at any point if you wish to, however if they are the subjects which you took your A levels in, no one will care about the improved GCSE grade. The only reasons for doing it would be if you failed English or Maths since there are a lot of places that wont take you if you don’t have a pass in those two subjects, or if you do not have at least 5 different subjects to GCSE or better

You can take O levels/GCSEs at any session. There's no age limit. But why bother? With certain exceptions (like needing GCSE Maths & English if applying for many British public sector jobs or Teacher Training), your O levels/ GCSEs are there to get you onto your A level courses. A levels are to get you to university After University, practically no one cares about O levels.
